Stream creation isn’t a common operation, and we don’t want to encourage users to do it by accident when they probably meant to create a topic.
There is no option on left-sidebar for creating a topic so there is no way the user do it by accident as it will also show a toolip "create stream " so is a no chance of accident which you say.

You’re thinking too locally. The left sidebar shows topics in it when a stream is expanded, so in order to create one, the user might try to click the only + button they can find there.

But the more important point is that Interface additions should be driven by use cases. If you just throw buttons in everywhere because you can, you end up with a confusing mess.

We used to have a + button there that let a user subscribe to more streams, but changed that to the text version because the + was invisible to many users, who as a result thought that the streams in the sidebar were the only ones that existed.

We can think more about this design space -- like maybe the "STREAMS" label could be "SUBSCRIPTIONS" to better hint that, though I think STREAMS is a better label for the use case of actually browsing messages.

I think a few people have independently suggested changing the wording here to things like "join stream" or "subscribe to more streams":

image.png
(that's the link at the bottom of the stream list...some folks may not have known that exists, since it's often below the fold)
Yeah, "Subscribe to more streams" seems in line with "Invite more users" and I do think is clearer about its meaning than "Add".
I'd be on board for that change as long as it doesn't create line-wrapping issues.

I have a PR that changes the implementation of the left panel of Manage Streams, and I would discourage @Ritik ☠️ from spending too much time on this until a) my PR lands on master and b) we get a business decision from Tim.

As other folks here seem to think, I find the current paradigm of Subscribed | All to be awkward. My primary use case is to add new streams, so ideally Manage Streams would put be in an Unsubscribed tab by default, instead of making me tab to All with all the current clutter of streams that I'm already subscribed to.

Anders Kaseorg said:

We could show all streams by default and remove the Subscribed filter in favor of a new default sort order that puts your subscriptions at the top?

One complication here is that the current behavior for search filtering is that we put your name-matching streams above your description-match streams, even if there's another sort in place. I view that as a misfeature, but that's the status quo.
